definitions: affected by magic or supernatural influence as if under a spell
completely captivated or enchanted by someone or something
examples: The bewitched prince could not speak until kissed
She walked through the bewitched forest with caution
He seemed bewitched by her graceful dance performance
The audience sat bewitched throughout the entire concert

definitions: so beautiful or attractive as to cast a spell over someone
possessing an enchanting quality that seems magical or supernatural
examples: Her bewitching smile caught everyone's attention immediately
The actress gave a bewitching performance on stage
The bewitching melody seemed to transport listeners elsewhere
There was something bewitching about the moonlit garden

definitions: happening two times a year at regular six-month intervals
examples: The company holds biannual meetings in January and July
Students receive biannual report cards each semester

definitions: unfairly prejudiced for or against someone or something
examples: The biased judge was removed from the case
Her biased opinion prevented her from seeing facts

definitions: relating to or contained in the Bible or its teachings
very great in size or extent like events described in the Bible
examples: The biblical stories teach important moral lessons today
Scholars study biblical texts in their original languages
The storm caused biblical flooding throughout the region
The famine reached biblical proportions affecting millions worldwide

definitions: relating to the study, listing, or description of books and writings
examples: The bibliographic information includes author and publication date
She compiled a bibliographic database for research purposes

definitions: concerning the systematic description and history of books and manuscripts
examples: The bibliographical essay examined rare manuscript collections thoroughly
His bibliographical research revealed previously unknown first editions

definitions: having two branches or chambers, especially in a legislative body
examples: The bicameral legislature consists of senate and house
Most democratic countries have adopted bicameral parliamentary systems

definitions: relating to or marking a two-hundredth anniversary of an event
examples: The bicentenary celebration attracted thousands of visitors nationwide
They planned special bicentenary events throughout the year

definitions: occurring every two hundred years or relating to a 200th anniversary
examples: The nation's bicentennial celebration lasted an entire week
They issued special bicentennial coins for the anniversary

definitions: having two different colors in distinct areas or patterns
examples: The bicolor rose had red and white petals
She wore a stylish bicolor dress to the party

definitions: moving or operating in two opposite directions simultaneously or alternately
examples: The bidirectional data flow improved network efficiency significantly
This bidirectional road allows traffic in both directions

definitions: taking place every other year or lasting for two years
examples: The biennial art exhibition attracts international artists worldwide
These biennial plants bloom in their second year

definitions: divided into two branches or parts from a common point
examples: The bifurcated river flows around the island
The company's bifurcated strategy targets two distinct markets

definitions: greater in size, amount, or degree than something else
examples: We need a bigger house for our growing family
The bigger problem is finding qualified staff members

definitions: having or showing strong unreasonable beliefs and disliking other groups
examples: His bigoted remarks offended everyone at the meeting
The bigoted policies were challenged in court successfully

definitions: involving two parties, countries, or sides equally in agreement or arrangement
examples: The bilateral trade agreement benefits both nations equally
She underwent bilateral knee surgery last month successfully

definitions: able to speak two languages fluently or using two languages
examples: The bilingual teacher translates for non-English speaking parents
This bilingual dictionary helps students learn vocabulary effectively

definitions: having a projecting mouthpart or beak of specified type
advertised or described in a particular way for promotion
examples: The long-billed bird caught fish with ease
The duck-billed platypus is a unique Australian mammal
The event was billed as the concert of the year
The movie was billed as a romantic comedy classic

definitions: of or relating to the game of billiards
examples: He practiced his billiard skills every evening diligently
The billiard table needed new felt covering urgently

definitions: filled with air and swelling outward in soft rounded masses
examples: The billowing clouds promised an approaching storm system
Her billowing dress caught the wind beautifully outside

definitions: happening once every two months at regular intervals
happening twice a month or every two weeks
examples: The bimonthly magazine publishes six issues per year
Our bimonthly meetings occur in odd-numbered months only
The bimonthly payroll runs on the 15th and 30th
Employees receive bimonthly paychecks throughout the year regularly

definitions: composed of or involving two things or parts only
relating to a system using only zeros and ones
examples: The binary choice was between yes and no
Binary star systems orbit around their common center
Computers process information using binary code exclusively today
The binary number system underlies all digital technology

definitions: of, relating to, or involving both ears simultaneously in hearing
examples: Binaural headphones create realistic three-dimensional sound experiences
The binaural recording captured sounds from two microphones

definitions: imposing an obligation that cannot be broken legally or morally
serving to hold or tie things together securely
examples: The binding contract requires both parties' full compliance
Their binding agreement cannot be changed without consent
The binding tape reinforced the book's damaged spine
She added binding material to strengthen the quilt edges

definitions: relating to or using both eyes together for vision
examples: Binocular vision provides depth perception for daily activities
The binocular microscope allows viewing with both eyes

definitions: relating to chemical processes and substances occurring in living organisms
examples: Biochemical reactions in cells produce energy for life
The biochemical analysis revealed abnormal protein levels present

definitions: capable of being decomposed by bacteria or other living organisms naturally
examples: Biodegradable packaging reduces environmental pollution significantly today
These biodegradable bags decompose within six months completely

definitions: dealing with or describing the facts of someone's life story
examples: The biographical film depicted the scientist's remarkable achievements
She included biographical details in her research paper

definitions: of or relating to biology or living organisms and processes
examples: The biologic evidence supported the theory of evolution
Biologic systems demonstrate remarkable complexity and organization patterns

definitions: producing and emitting light through biochemical reactions in living organisms
examples: Bioluminescent plankton create glowing waves at night spectacularly
The bioluminescent mushrooms glow green in complete darkness

definitions: relating to the application of natural sciences to clinical medicine
examples: Biomedical research seeks new treatments for human diseases
The biomedical engineer designed artificial heart valves successfully

definitions: having artificial body parts that enhance natural biological capabilities electronically
having extraordinary abilities as if electronically or mechanically enhanced
examples: The bionic arm responds to nerve signals precisely
Bionic implants help restore vision to blind patients
The athlete's bionic speed amazed all the spectators
She has bionic hearing that catches every whispered word

definitions: relating to or resulting from living organisms in an environment
examples: Biotic factors include all plants and animals present
The biotic community adapted to changing environmental conditions

definitions: involving cooperation between two political parties that usually oppose each other
examples: The bipartisan bill received overwhelming support from Congress
They reached a bipartisan agreement on education reform

definitions: consisting of or divided into two separate parts or sections
examples: The bipartite agreement outlined responsibilities for each party
The leaf has a distinctive bipartite structure naturally

definitions: walking upright on two feet as the primary form of locomotion
examples: Humans are bipedal creatures unlike most other mammals
The bipedal robot walked smoothly across uneven terrain

definitions: having two opposite or contradictory ideas, opinions, or aspects
relating to a mental condition with alternating periods of depression and mania
examples: The bipolar magnet has north and south ends
The bipolar debate divided the community into opposing camps
She manages her bipolar disorder with medication and therapy
The bipolar symptoms include extreme mood swings regularly

definitions: concerning or containing members of two different racial groups
examples: Their biracial children celebrate both cultural heritages proudly
The biracial community organized a multicultural festival downtown

definitions: made from or relating to the pale wood of birch trees
examples: The birch cabinets brightened the entire kitchen space
She selected birch flooring for its durability and appearance

definitions: sexually attracted to both men and women as potential partners
examples: The bisexual community advocates for greater visibility and acceptance
Many bisexual individuals face unique challenges regarding identity

definitions: causing a sharp stinging sensation especially from cold weather
cruel or harsh in tone or manner when speaking
examples: The biting wind made everyone seek shelter quickly
A biting frost damaged the early spring flowers
Her biting remarks hurt more than physical pain
The critic's biting review destroyed the play's reputation

definitions: arousing pleasure tinged with sadness or pain simultaneously
examples: Graduation was a bittersweet moment for the students
The bittersweet memories of childhood filled her thoughts

definitions: occurring once every two weeks at regular intervals
happening twice a week on specific days
examples: The biweekly paycheck arrives every other Friday regularly
Our biweekly meetings help track project progress effectively
The biweekly exercise classes meet Tuesdays and Thursdays
She attends biweekly therapy sessions for stress management

definitions: made black or very dark especially by burning or charring
examples: The blackened walls showed evidence of fire damage
He served blackened fish with spicy Cajun seasoning

definitions: having a color that is nearly but not quite black
examples: The blackish clouds threatened to bring heavy rain
She noticed blackish spots appearing on the leaves

definitions: equipped with or characterized by having blades or blade-like parts
examples: The bladed turbine generated electricity from wind efficiently
Multi-bladed tools offer versatility for different cutting tasks

definitions: unfairly held responsible or accused for something negative
examples: The blamed employee proved his innocence with evidence
She felt blamed for circumstances beyond her control

definitions: innocent of wrongdoing and not deserving blame or criticism
examples: The investigation proved she was completely blameless
His blameless reputation remained intact throughout the scandal

definitions: lacking strong flavor, taste, or seasoning in food
lacking strong features or characteristics that create interest
examples: The bland soup needed salt and pepper desperately
Hospital food is often bland for dietary reasons
His bland personality made him forgettable at parties
The bland decor failed to inspire any emotional response
